description: Students examine political, economic, religious and/or social issues through textual
analysis of literary and/or non-literary works representing diverse voices of the
Spanish-speaking world (e.g. indigenous people, women, non-Castilian nationalities in
Spain, or Afro-Hispanic groups). The course includes study of at least one substantive
literary work. Sample topics include: Women and Repression or The Afro-Hispanic Struggle
for Identity.  May be repeated if topic is different. Taught in Spanish.  Prerequisites:
SPAN 250 and at least one 270-level course.
